text: Ah thank you very much. Thank you. Thank you Fayetteville and North Carolina thank you very much. Tomorrow we are going to win this state and we are going to win four more years in our great white house. With your vote we will continue to cut your taxes, cut regulations, support our great police, support our fantastic military, care for our Veterans, protect your second amendment, defend religious liberty, and ensure more products are proudly stamped with that wonderful phrase "Made in the USA". Next year will be the greatest economic year in the history of our country.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Under my leadership our economy is now growing at the fastest rate ever recorded; 33.1%. Just announced last week. We created a record 11.4 million jobs in the last five months. It's a number that we never even thought possible. Nobody did. Nobody thought it was possible and now we're going to do better than that.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: It's going very rapidly. While foreign nations are in a free fall; you see what's going on with so many nations in Europe unfortunately. I say that with sadness. We are creating an economic powerhouse unrivaled anywhere in the world. A recent data poll found the 56% of Americans found they are better off today than they were four years ago under Obama and Biden.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You gotta remember that, you gotta remember that kind of thing. They didn't do a good job. In fact if they did I wouldn't have run. If they did I wouldn't be here right now. They did a bad job and Obama, he went out yesterday with Biden. They got like 14 people. They didn't have to many. They didn't have to good a crowd and we have five of these today, five.

text: We have some big ones. Thank you. Thank you, Thank you very much, thank you, thank you very much. Thank you and I love you too, and I appreciate that. We appreciate it. I was, I was thinking coming in because I watch these state polls, every one. No matter, if we're up by 10, if we know we're going to win easily "he's down by one point, he's down by one". Uh, I just watched this fake stuff and I'm saying to myself "You know, we've been under a phonie, fake, hoax investigation for three years." Nothing but bad and really corrupt publicity from these people.

text: And I say "I wonder what the difference would have been if it had been legit" and it turned out to be just the opposite. They were the ones that committed the crimes, not us . But I wonder what it would've been? It probably would've been a little bit easier but you know the good news, we're going to win anyway.

text: We're going to shove it, we're going to win anyway. I wonder what it would've been. I wonder what it would've been if all of the nonsense wasn't brought up. [Audience chants "Four more years"] Thank you very much. Thank you very much. Looking tremendous in Florida so of course they don't mention that. You know, Florida the, we are looking good.

text: We're really looking good all over in the real polls not the Fox polls. Those Fox polls, somebody at Fox doesn't like me very much I can tell you. They are the phoniest [Inaudible]. What to do with this? No, but thank you.

text: You know? The hidden voter or whatever they call them. Somebody said they're the shy voters. My people are not shy. They're not shy. text: It's just a lobbyist. So, they didn't say like, "He's two down, three down, four down," a fake poll. They said, "Trump is 17 points down in Wisconsin." Now, the real number -- I mean, I could lose it, I could win it. I think it's -- You know, how I'm not. I did a lot of good things for Wisconsin. But, you know, let's say it's even, and I call up a great pollster, John.

I think we're one up in Wisconsin, but ABC/Washington Post -- " They did the same thing four years ago if you remember, th -- very close to the election. text: What it does is it suppresses people. They say, "Well listen, we love the president, but if he can't win -- "So ABC -- But they did it four years ago and we complained bitterly with a very good lawyer. I had very good lawyers in those days. We complained very bitterly, and they changed it right before the election.

text: I think it was one, right? We were down one. They took it from 12 to one and it like -- about 15 seconds. And I realized, I said, "This is a phony business." But now they come down and it says, 17 down in Wisconsin, 17. So I call John, John McLaughlin. He's, he's like the dean. He's a great guy and he's been very good with me.

text: I mean, he said we were gonna win four years ago. He said i -- He said we're gonna win easily this one. He's a -- He's probably the biggest and the best. I said, "John, let me ask you a question. ABC/Washington Post came out with a poll. It said I was 17 down. I'm not 17 down. I might be one down or I might be two up, but I'm not 17 down.

text: What's going on? Why don't they make it at least -- "Because they have to live after that, they have to do other events and other -- Why don't they make it three or four or two or five or something, right? He said, "They can't do that 'cause they want you to lose, and if you're two or three or four, everyone's gonna go vote.

text: They wanna make sure that your people don't vote. And when you're 17 down, people say, 'I just can't waste my time. I'm not gonna stand in line.'" And I said, "Isn't that sick?" And he said he knows some of the people and they're very smart, they're very brilliant, they're smart people. He said, "But if they made it five down or four down or six down, even -- So they make it something that's so bad, 17 down." I said, "Isn't that a shame?

text: I wanna tell that story. Do you mind?" He said, "I don't care. That's the way it is." So it's crooked stuff. The Fox polls are horrible. Every time I have a Fox poll it's horrible. I mean, I like some of the things on Fox, certainly Sean and Laura, and Tucker's been great lately. And Fox and Friends in the morning is great, right?

text: I said, "I gotta tell that answer." So, I hope I haven't bored you, but I thought it was interesting. Well? You good? I thought it was interesting. To me, it was interesting. And, and you know, I have like, uh, five of these to do today, so let's get going. I appreciate you being here. We had some, we had some monsters last night.

text: We had some, a little rough weather. It wasn't like this. We had, uh, in Michigan, we had a (laughs) slightly cold day, with the wind blowing at 40 miles an hour, in my face. And, you're lucky you have a President that doesn't need a teleprompter. I was able to -- Good memory. I would've been in big trouble.

text: There was no way you could hold paper. There was no way you could do, you were just -- And my guys set it up where the wind was right smack in my face. And I was looking at that flag from the play, and I said, "Oh, no. Here we go again." But actually, the flag must be a very high quality silk, because it's not that windy.

text: But yesterday, it was not, that was not an easy day. We had some very cold stops. If Biden and Harris, Kamala, Kamala. You want her? You want her as your first woman President? I don't think so. And the radical left gained power. they will collapse our economy and send our nation into a depression. Biden will raise your taxes four trillion dollars, massively increase your regulations, close down your factories, send your jobs overseas.

text: That's what he's been doing all his life, him and his group. Destroy the suburbs, dissolve your borders, terminate religious liberty, outlaw private health insurance. 180 million people have great health insurance. Shred your Second Amendment, confiscate your guns and indoctrinate your children with anti-American lies.

text: Biden has vowed to abolish the American oil and natural gas industries and ban fracking. He said it for a year and a half, he said it. Then all of a sudden, he goes to Pennsylvania, "No. I never said that." And the fake news doesn't do anything about it. I mean, that was while I was, while I was running. I didn't even know.

I said, "I have nothing to do with Russia.

It was a plot to overthrow the government of the United States. And then we have people that just don't act fast, I mean, it's just unbelievable.

Thank you. Thank you, thank you.

We got you the biggest tax cut in history, the biggest regulation cut in history. We've rebuilt our military. Our vets just gave us a 91% approval rating, on what we've done for them. We've got you Space Force, and you'll be making a lot of the stuff, right here in Michigan.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Face -- Space Force is the first -- That is the first time, in 74 years, since Air Force. Think of that. Right? A whole new force. I just signed an executive order, on Air Force One, to teach our students pro-American values. It's a good thing. With all the things that I've been watching, that have been taking place over a pretty long period of time, a pretty long period of time, even before Obama and Sleepy Joe.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Biden has vowed to abolish the American oil and natural gas industries and to ban fracking. Look, he said it. He said it. [Audience boos] He campaigned, for over a year, "We will ban fracking. We will ban fracking. We will ban fracking." Then he goes to Pennsylvania and they said, "Well, you know." His people told him.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: He didn't have any idea what they meant, but it was okay. He listens to 'em. They said, "Listen, you have to be in favor of fracking now." He said, "Okay. No problem. Why?" I always said it about 200 times during debates. Right? So they've been -- So now he goes into Pennsylvania, where we just left. Great people, by the way.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You talk about -- That was a, an unbelievably enthusiastic group of people. We're going to win Pennsylvania. We're going to win. We're going to win Michigan, too. We're going to win. We're going to win Pennsylvania. We won Pennsylvania last time, too. We won this one, we won -- This one hadn't been won for many, many years, and Pennsylvania the same thing.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: It wouldn't -- But then Trump came along We won them both. We beat crooked Hillary, crooked Hillary. Now we have a guy that makes Hillary look like a baby. No, we had some -- We've had a good time. And until the Chinese, until the China plague came along, everything was good. We closed it down, we saved two million lives.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Now we're opening it up. We had the greatest economy we've ever had. See the hat? All the make America great again, now we're having it make America great again, again. You know? And our country was coming together. You know, the other side was calling. Everybody was successful. Best numbers for unemployment, African-American, Hispanic American.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And, by the way, do you see what's going on in Florida? African-American, the numbers are phenomenal. Hispanic American, the numbers are beyond belief. They got problems. You notice they haven't been talking too much about Florida for the last, uh, six or seven hours? They're not liking what they see. They're not -- Wow, that is a lot of people.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Look, you can't even see. Why don't you take the cameras down there? You can't even see the end. I hope you can hear us down there. It's like two football fields away. I hope you can hear us. That's great. Wow, that's really good. But, uh, no, Florida's looking great. You're looking great. Came out two or three up.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I don't why two or three up. You know, am I supposed to be happy with three up over this guy? I tell you. But, you know what? Let's just put the win in the column. We won't even talk about it. But you're looking great. North Carolina, great. Um, Iowa came out, the big poll came out yesterday. You saw it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And we were a lot up. Big, big up. Well, the farmer's like me, you know? I got, for the farmers, 28 billion dollars I got, 28 billion from China. Thank you very much, China. Thank you. Because they targeted the farmers. They targeted the farmers, and I said to Sonny Perdue, Secretary of Agriculture, "Sonny, how much?" He said, "Well, two years ago, it was 12. And last year it was 16 billion." 16 billion, 12 billion.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: A total of 28 billion. And I tariffed China. We took the 28 billion. We had a lot of money left over, into the treasury, and we gave it to the farmers, and the farmers are not complaining. I tell you, they're in business. They would have been out of business. Biden's energy ban will send every state into crushing poverty [Inaudible]. And you know this, you know what they're doing, from Michigan to Wisconsin to Arizona, where we're leading very nicely, thank you, and to Pennsylvania.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: As long as I'm president, we will remain the number one producer of oil and natural gas on earth. And we will remain energy independent. We're energy independent for the first time, first time. That means we don't have to call people up in far away places and say, "We need some oil, please. We'll send our armies over there to protect you and help you." But we do have great allies over there.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We'll help them. And we've certainly helped Israel, but we have a lot of good people over there. We'll help them. But we don't need their oil. It's nice not to need -- We have more oil than they do now. You know, we have actually more oil than they do. We're the largest in the world. Isn't that a nice feeling?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Sleepy Joe -- And that would not have happened, except for what we've done over the last three and-a-half years. There's never been an administration, or president, there's never been an administration that has done, in the first three and-a-half years what we've done. Never. And not even close. With all the things we've done.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And the fake news never even questions it. I've been saying it for a long time. They don't even question it because they can't. Joe Biden is a globalist who spent 47 years outsourcing your jobs, opening your borders, and sacrificing American blood and treasure in endless, ridiculous foreign wars. Countries you've never even heard of.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: A vote for Biden is a vote to extinguish and eradicate your state's auto industry. You don't like that, do you? I don't think so. You know, he was going to do the PPP, he was going to do different things that would've been so bad for you. I ended it, I ended it all. He was a cheerleader for NAFTA, which was the worst trade deal ever made, probably by any country, that sent all your auto jobs -- You know, they have 32% of our auto jobs, right?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And, uh, It's probably the number one reason I ran for president. And, in fact, I was in Michigan. I don't know if anybody remembers this, 12 years ago they gave me the Man of the Year. You remember? And I had a big, I made a speech and I said, "Why are you letting," uh, you know, it's not my business," but I said, "Why are you letting them steal your auto jobs?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They're all going down to Mexico." And by the way, plenty go to Canada, too, right? People don't know that. And it was a terrible thing that took place, but we've stopped that and now the USMCA makes it very, very financially difficult for them to do that. It was very important to me. And everybody said, "We'll never be able to do it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We'll never be able to end NAFTA." And you know what? Because it was so good for Canada and so good for Mexico, and they have a lot of power, but we ended it and, uh, they're not that happy but they're happy enough and we have a great deal, and we have, uh, people. I'll tell you, Mexico, we've had a great relationship with Mexico.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Canada's a little difficult to deal with, to be honest with you. You know, O Canada. We all love O Canada, right? I love that. They stand for their national anthem and we have to stand too because, you know, you know, you saw the ratings on the NBA down 71% for their championship. You know why? Because people don't want to hear it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They don't want to hear it. They want to see a basketball game. Obviously, not too much, but I didn't watch it and a lot of people didn't watch it. And the NFL has to be very careful. They tried that game two years ago and I thought we taught them a lesson, and they have to be very careful. We have to respect our flag, we have to respect our anthem, and we have to respect our country. [Audience chants "USA"] Sleepy Joe supported China's entry into the WTO.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Michigan lost half of all auto manufacturing jobs after those Biden betrayals. He also supported the Transpacific Partnership, which would have been the death sentence for the U.S. auto industry. I canceled TPP, I ended the NAFTA disaster, and I took the toughest action ever taken against China. We never took in 10 cents on China.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I've taken in billions and billions of dollars over the last two years. Joe Biden is a corrupt politician. They don't want to write about it. They don't want to write about it. They're not allowed to write about it. Their bosses, whoever their bosses may be, they're not allowed to write about it. Who sold out Michigan to China, he sold you out.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: That's one of the reasons, when they send over a car they charge us 35% tax, we charge them nothing. But those days are changed. We changed it. We changed it. And it's going to change a lot more if you give us another four years, that I can tell you. We were just beginning. We were just beginning, and not only with China, with everyone else who takes advantage of our country. [Audience chants "Four more years"] Thank you very much.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: No, but with everybody else it takes a -- It's not only China, it's everybody. We renegotiated the South Korea deal. You know that. That was a deal, crooked Hillary made that deal. It was going to give 250,000 jobs. She was talking, "This will produce 250,000 jobs." They signed it and she ended up being correct, but the 250,000 jobs all went to South Korea, not to us.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: That was standard. That was standard. Biden is the living embodiment of the decrepit and depraved political class that got rich bleeding America dry. And you know what happened. Look, there haven't been too many states that have been effected like you've been effected. You got seriously effected. [Audience chants "Drain the swamp"] That's what we're doing.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We're doing it. But when I ran, you never told me it was going to be that deep, that vicious, that rotten. It's a deep sucker. I thought we'd knock it out fast. We went through three and a half years of hell and here we are, and they're not too happy and they're, they're reeling. They're reeling. They're going to be knocked off very soon.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They're going to be all knocked off very soon. Now we've, we've done a good job but it was, it wasn't easy. You get impeached over a telephone call that was perfect, perfect call. Perfect call. Congratulations on your victory Ukraine president, Ukraine. Nice man. Never met him before congratulations. "Sir, could you call up and congratulate the president of Ukraine?" "Sure.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: What happens?" "Oh, he just won." "Okay, good." So I give him a call. I avoided it for a long time because it was a lot, you know, busy. Call up and they say, "Let's impeach him." I'll tell you. And we had great support from the Republican Party. I have to say that. 197 to nothing in the House. 52.5 to 0.5. You know how the half was?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: That's all right. We had 52.5 to 0.5. Mitt Romney. [Audience boos] He still doesn't know why. He say, "Let's see, why did I do that?" Uh, he, he wished he didn't do it. I'll tell you that. In 2016 Michigan voted to fire this corrupt political establishment. And you elected an outsider as president who finally put America first.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And if I don't sound like a typical Washington politician it's because I'm not a politician. Probably wouldn't be here if I was. And if I don't always play by the rules of Washington, or the Washington establishment, it's because I was elected to fight for you, and I fight harder and harder and harder. And better than anyone's ever fought for you.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We, we were brought here, we were put here to fight for you. I had a very easy life before this, I have to tell you. [Audience chants "Thank you Trump"] Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you very much. I had a very easy life, I had a different kind of a life. And you know what? I wouldn't have changed that decision when I said, "First Lady, let's do it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You're gonna be First Lady." She was actually one of the people. She said, "Are you sure you want to do this?" First Lady. People love the First Lady, they do. They love her. She's great. She's elegant. And she puts up with a lot from these people, you know? It's like, unbelievable. [Audience boos] But she said uh, "But are you sure you want to do this?" And I say, "I think I do.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Yeah. I think I do." She said, "You know you will win if you do it. You must be sure." And I said, "You think so?" I said, "You think so really?" And she said, "No, you will win definitely. But the question is, do you want to do it?" I said, "Yeah, we do. We have to set this nation back on the right course." I'm sorry.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: No. She said that. And I'll never forget that. I always thought it was cool. You know? You know you're, it's like, second nature. You know you're wed, you know, for good, running against a lot of very talented people. And then we had to run against a very talented, crooked machine. Joe Biden is bought and paid for by big tech, big media, and powerful special interests. [Audience boos] You saw that over the last couple of weeks. [Audience boos] All the corruption, and they refuse to even talk about it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Could you imagine if I got 3.5 million from the mayor of Moscow's wife? Or one of my kids took 3.5 million from -- Can you imagine that? And they refuse to even discuss it. They don't want to discuss it. There is no proof. They now say the laptop from hell was produced by Russia. This was Schiff. Watermelon Head, right? "The laptop, uh, was produced by Russia." And we say, "Oh, oh, not again." No, John Ratcliffe came out immediately.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: He's great. He's doing a great job. He said, "It was not produced by Russia." So, but that's what they try and do. They do disinformation. They're the biggest disinformation group, I'll tell you. They own him, they control Biden, and they know he will always do whatever they want. They know that. That's why they want him.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I definitely don't do what they want. I definitely don't. Except I do one thing, I get them good ratings. Can you imagine if they don't have me? Let's say they had Biden. Their ratings will collapse, every one of them will be out of business. They'll be out of business so fast. Every corrupt [Inaudible], it won't be, it will be -- They will be out of business so fast.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: In fact, I think they're gonna get together, The New York Times will die. The failing New York Times. Washington Post. Which is basically a lobbyist for Bezos. You know that. But they'll all get together and they'll say, "Listen, we made a big mistake here. We got to draft Trump. We got to get him to run again.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: This is no good." "We're dying, nobody cares." Can you imagine that? Having Biden. We're gonna put something up. Can you imagine having Biden as your president? [Audience boos] The biggest loser will be the fake news media, they will, that will be so boring. You know their ratings are through the roof. Everything's through the roof.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: The NFL is doing very badly. You know why? Everyone's watching politics, because they find politics to be much rougher than the NFL. Much dirtier, and more disgusting, and -- And they don't change. You know the NFL, they change the rules. They make everything like coming back, you can't touch anybody. Somebody tackles too hard.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They say, "15 yard penalty and you're out of the game, and you're out for the season." You know the old days, right? It was a little different, but it's still tough. But this is much tougher. And people see it. But you have to see the ratings. It's -- That's why the ratings are bad for a lot of the sports.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Nobody ever thought of this, but I thought of it. Couple of people wrote it. The ratings are bad because so many people are watching this. It's tougher. True. But they're going to be calling for us, "Please, please run again. We think, uh, we are going to endorse you." I got endorsed by the Pittsburgh -- Right?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Pittsburgh Post Gazette. I got endorsed, first time since 1972. Right? It's a big deal. Big [Inaudible] are very good. Very liberal newspaper, but that's okay. But first time since 1972 that they endorsed a Republican, so it's an honor. And if you don't read the first two or three paragraphs it was one of the best endorsements.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Yes, we don't like him. Yes, he has a horrible personality. But listen to this. It's not that they do, but I have been under siege, illegally, for three and a half years. I've been fighting for three and a half years. And I said to somebody today, I wonder what it would be like if the fake Russia hoax, and all this crap with the impeachment over nothing, over a phone call that was perfect.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: That was perfect. I wonder what it would be like if we didn't have all of this horrible stuff. And, and if it didn't -- You know, we'd have a very calm, a calm situation. And maybe I'd be less popular. I don't know. Maybe I'd be less popular. Because you know what? The fact is, people see that we fight.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We're fighting for you. But it's just a really -- It's a really dirty, horrible business. But I said today, because they were very -- They would say, "Jeez, they don't like the personality, and he's always fighting." I'm fighting to survive. You have to survive. Very few people would have survived. They would have been in the corner.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They would have said, "Mommy, Mommy," put their finger in their mouth, put their thumb in the mouth and say, "Mommy, mommy, take me home. I'm out of here. Get me the hell out of here, Mommy." They'd say, "Forget about the American people, Mommy, I want out of here right now." No, we can't do that. But we have to fight hard.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And then you fight hard, and you hit them back and then they say, "There's chaos in the White House." They caused the chaos. We have a great group of people. We have a lot of them here tonight. Great people in the White House. But it's true. I wonder why -- I wonder w -- if it would have been different.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You know, if they didn't -- Because these were all -- We caught them spying on our campaign. We caught them trying to take out a duly elected president of the United States. That's treason. That's treason. We caught them. And someday maybe something's going to be done about it, too, you know? Maybe. Oh boy, oh boy, oh boy.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They can't -- We don't want to do anything prior to the election. But what about me? They did it -- They did it to me before the -- They spied on my campaign before the election. "We shouldn't do anything prior to the election." And you know who we caught? Barack Hussein Obama, and sleepy Joe Biden. They were a part of it. [Audience boos] We ought to get these reports out.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They should get them out before the election, as far as I'm concerned. They should get them out right before the election. They should have gotten them out a long time ago. We have, we have information -- You wouldn't even believe it. I don't even get involved. I always said I'm going to stay uninvolved.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: It's very hard for me to do, I'll tell you. No, it is, because you know, I didn't, I didn't have to do that. I thought it would be the right thing. And yet they did the Mueller report, right? The phony Mueller report. 18 angry Democrats, smart. 18 angry, vicious -- Many of them worked for Hillary Clinton. 18 angry Democrats.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They spent $48 million, and at the end of two and a half years, no collusion, okay? A friend of mine said, "You have to be the most innocent man in the world. And they checked everything. They checked taxes, they checked -- For $48 million you check taxes, right? And by the way we announced, you know, I prepaid millions and millions of dollars in taxes.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They didn't say that. They refused to say. They say, "Well, prepaying isn't paying." I said, "No, it's prepay, that's even worse." Millions of dollars. Many millions of dollars. And that'll all come out. Every correct -- And you know when you look at it, when you look at what's ha -- gone on, seriously, think of that.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Just think about that tonight when you're with your family. I wonder if it would have been difficult, you know, different. I wonder if it would have been a different kind of a feel. And you know what? Honestly, maybe it wouldn't have been as good. Maybe we wouldn't have these massive crowds because you see what somebody is where we're under siege, and you people get it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You're smarter than them. You're smarter than these people. You get it. And you've always, and you've always gotten it and it's a beautiful thing, and I'll never forget it. I want to tell you, I'm never going to forget it. But we were under siege and we caught them, and it's treason or whatever you want to call it, but with Sleepy Joe Biden, they don't want to write anything.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We caught the whole thing. The son, where's Hunter? Where's Hunter? The son was like a human vacuum cleaner. He'd go in and follow his father. "Let's go to China today, son." They fly in on Air Force Two, right? I guarantee you one thing, Mike Pence, I know his kids. They don't do that. They don't do that.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They're unbelievable kids. Military. But, you know, um, "Let's go to China today, Dad." I'd like to follow you. It's like, err. Walks out with one and a half billion dollars. Fees on -- Oh, he must be a great investor. You know the greatest investors don't make that deal with China. China doesn't do that.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They don't give money out for other people that are less smart than them to invest. Let's give our money to somebody that's not very smart to invest, okay? That's a great idea. He walked out. It only took him 10 minutes to get it, too. $1.5 billion, that's millions of dollars in fees. The big one was the 10 million.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You saw that one? The letter. He wants 10 million a year for introductory purposes. Okay, 10 million. But it all blew up. By that time, the laptop from hell was found. The one that Schiff said was developed in Russia. It's unbelievable. And then you have Ukraine. He goes into Ukraine. His father was in charge of Ukraine, right?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: He was in charge of Russia, Ukraine, China, specifically. He goes into Ukraine. $183,000 a month. "Do you have energy experience?" It's an energy, right? Burisma. "Do you have energy experience?" "No, I don't. I don't know anything about energy." "Well, we'll pay you $183,000 a month and we'll give you an upfront fee of approximately 3 million.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Would that be satisfactory?" No, think of it. No, think of it. And that's -- and there are other things, too. Other con-- Then he's got the brother and he's got all -- This is a corrupt enterprise. And then they had -- the big man gets 10%. The big man. Who's the big -- He's not a big man to me. To me, he's a very meek, fragile -- He's a fragile person and he's very agitated.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I watched him today. He gets more -- He gets more time on Fox. I've never seen anybody on Fox so much. Him, they have everybody on Fox. They have all enemies on Fox. I can't -- I think it's crazy. But he gets a lot of time on Fox. But he, he's so agitated and now he comes out with the aviator glasses, but they're a little too small.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They should be -- He wants to look like Tom Cruise from a long time ago. No, but he's fragile. He's not gonna be there. That's not what they're counting on. They're counting on somebody else. They're counting on by far the most liberal person in the senate, Kamala. They like her. They like Kamala. Every corrupt force in American life that betrayed you and hurt you is supporting Joe Biden.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: The failed establishment that started the disastrous foreign Wars, they support Biden. The career politicians that offshored your industries and decimated your auto plants, and you suffered for many, many years. I'm telling you, that's why I'm here, I think primarily. That was the first thing, trade. I said, "How could they do that?" They supported Biden.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: The open borders lobbyists that killed our fellow citizens with illegal drugs and gangs and crime that poured into our country, they support Biden. They still do. The anti-American radicals, defaming our noble history, heritage, and heroes. They support Biden. They support him. They support Sleepy Joe. And you know, I signed a law that you take down any of our statues, any of our monuments, you go to jail for 10 years.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: It's amazing the way it seemed to have stopped, isn't it? It's really amazing. Somebody said, "Oh, it's just stopped." No, it didn't just stop. I took an old law and reactivated it because the new law and you go into this with this bunch, with Nancy Pelosi and Crying Chuck Schumer, you know what they'll do?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They'll give you a medal of your rip down the statues. Antifa and the rioters, looters, the Marxist, and left-wing extremists, they all support Joe Biden. This election comes down to a simple choice. Do you want to be ruled by the corrupt and selfish political class, or do you want to be governed by the American people, yourselves?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You know, the govern, the way we supposed to be. A vote for Biden a vote to give control of government over to the globalists and the communists, socialists and wealthy liberal hypocrites who want to silence, cancel and punish you. Cancel culture, they call it. Cancel culture. No, thank you. We want to be proud of our history.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Good, bad, whatever, we want our history. We want to know, and we want to learn from our history. We don't want our history canceled, we want to learn. There's things we have to learn from my history, too. If you want your children to be safe, if you want your values to be respected, if you want to be treated with honor, dignity and respect, then I am asking you to go tomorrow and vote for a person named President Trump.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Gotta win Michigan. This is a, this is a big, important place. We, if we win Michigan, it's over. It's over. We win the whole thing. Four more years, and then we can finish the job we started so well. We can finish the job. You know, I got nominated, can you be -- nah, I say it because they don't write it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I just heard today, I thought it was three, I got four, four Nobel Peace Prizes. Can you believe it? One for the Middle East. Ru -- one for Kosovo-Serbia. I mean whe -- they want to make a trade deal. They're each fighting each other for many decades. They're fighting, killing each other. You've read it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I mean, for years it, it just automatic, killing each other for many, many decades. And we're doing these trade deals with them, not big deals, but they want them very badly, we're doing them. And they're each doing them. And I said to the people, I said, "Listen, we're doing deals. They want to make the deal with us.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Everybody wants to make a deal with us." I said, "They're killing each other, I think, right? They're killing each other. I read about it. They're killing each other for decades. Tell them we're not making a deal, unless they get together and make a peace." And we told that to them. "We're not interested in doing deals, unless you guys could get along and not kill each other." You know, it's human lives.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We don't know where it is. You don't know where it is. Some people have never heard of the places. But they're places and they're people, they're human beings. And I said, "Tell them we're gonna do it, but you have to make peace." And we got them together, we made peace. And they actually nominated me for Nobel Peace Prize.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I got four nominations in four unrelated things, that's crazy, right? And I told the story, you probably heard about it. The first one I went up, Middle East. You know, the Middle East is coming along. Got no blood in the sand. No, nothing. The Middle East is great. Signed already, three countries. We have seven, eight, nine countries, they could all sign.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I said, "How did Obama do it?" And they told me, I said, "Good. We'll do it the opposite." But not only Obama. For many, many years, they haven't been able to do it. And we're gonna, we, we're really -- well, I'd like to finish that up too. Need a little more time, you know? We did need a little bit more time, but we're gonna, we have countries.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We have countries lined up, no money and no blood in the sand. No blood in the sand. Remember what I said four years ago, "I am your voice and I will make America great again." And, that's what we're doing. That's what we're doing. Together, we will defeat the corrupt establishment. We will dethrone the failed political class.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We will drain the Washington swamp, and we will save the American dream for your children, for your grandchildren. This election is also a choice between a deadly Biden lockdown or a safe vaccine. The vaccine is coming along great, couple of weeks, couple of weeks. It's gonna be out soon. That ends the pandemic.

He's the only one that understood what was going on, actually, but they came, and they came, and they wanted to be in Michigan, which was unscheduled. So I get a call from Ronna and the whole ground, and they said, "Could you go back?" We got here at 12:00 in the evening.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I started speaking at 12:30, now Election Day. I'll never forget it. We had 32,000, almost as many as we have tonight. And, And I said, I said to my team, "We have to -- This is it." You know, we've done five, but actually six because we ended up last night around 2:00 in the morning in Miami. So we can say that includes this, so that would be six.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We've done six of these big, and every one was just a lot of people, and you know what? There was a lot of love. There was a lot of love. There was a lot of love. We had 45,000 people in Florida last night. By the way, we're doing very well in Florida. We're doing very, very well in Wisconsin. We're doing very well in Texas.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I hear great things about Texas. You know, they're saying Texas may be even. Well, then you think, Sleepy Joe Biden's against guns. That's not good for Texas, right? [Audience boos] He's against oil. [Audience boos] Oil isn't good. If you're against oil, I don't think you're good -- That's not good politics, right, Texas?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And he's against God. [Audience boos] Right? So, you know, when you have guns, oil, and God, and he's doing well in Texas. I don't think so. But I actually know for a fact we're doing very well in Texas. I think we're doing very well all over. I think you're gonna have -- I don't know if it's as much of a sup -- I don't what's a surprise.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We fulfilled everything we said we were going to fulfill and that's why people are here. And we did somethings that we never even talked about, right? We never talked about Space Force, we got in and I said, "You know what?" I looked at Russia, I looked at China, I said, "We need Space Force and we did it first time in 74 years.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Not since the Air Force. But I wanna thank you all. You know, we have a great group of people here. I'd like to show our a appreciation for our phenomenal Vice President, Mike Pence and his amazing wife, Karen. Did he make a good speech? I saw him on the plane and I couldn't sort of -- Did he make a good speech?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Uh -- That's, he's great. I'll tell you what. I'll, I -- It was close. It was close. If I had my choice between Mike and Kamala, I think -- It's a very close choice, but I think I'll take, I think I'll take Mike. I think we'll stick with Mike and Karen. No. By the way, how badly did he beat her in that debate?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Did you ever hear the expression, "If that were fight they would've stopped it?" But anyway -- No, Mike's been great from day one and I appreciate it. I also want to thank Don Jr., Eric, Ivanka, Tiffany. Words cannot express how proud you make me every single day. No matter what happens tomorrow, I'm very proud of you all.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: But, if we don't win I'll never speak to them again. They like him. They like them all. No, no. I'm very, I'm very proud. We're very proud of you. Thank you. Look at these people. There's a lot of spirit here. There's a lot of spirit. No, it's, it's funny though. I kept saying, "We have to finish off here." Then we have to do it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: It's just, uh, we can be a little bit superstitious, right? But, you people you've been great. You've been great. And I think we're going to have a tremendous victory in Michigan. Don't forget, four years ago we said -- I said, "Why are so many car companies leaving?" You know, you were losing everything to Mexico, and to China, and to frankly Canada.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And you were losing everything. And we stopped it. And now you have many many car plants that have already been built, are being built. Renovation '17. You didn't have a deal in like 42 years, or so -- It was always going out. Now they're all coming in. I want to thank Prime Minister Abe of Japan. I said, Shinzo, Shinzo, you got to do me a favor, Shinzo.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You gotta, you gotta build some plants. And he said, "No, no, no, we are the government. We don't do that. That's up to the private sector." I said, "No, Shinzo, you gotta do it. You gotta do it. It's not fair, you're sending too many cars, and they're built in Japan." We wanted them built in Michigan. We want them built in Ohio.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We want them built in South Carolina, North Carolina. We gotta do it. He says, "But we do not do that, Donald." And the next day they announced five companies are coming to Michigan. So -- But he's a great guy. And he retired. He went to, uh, you know. He had some difficulty with, with his health. But he was a great, uh, Prime Minister of Japan.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And he did a great favor to Michigan, and to us, all of you. He's a -- We have a lot of, we have a lot of activity in Michigan. It would be nice if your governor would open up the state, however. He ought to open up the state. Open up your schools. Open up the states. Go back. Get back to business. The only one that's allowed to roam free is her husband.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: What's her husband like? [Audience boos] Remember? That wasn't so long go. He's allowed to do whatever he wants. But everybody else, you're not allowed to leave your house, or your apartment. No, she's gotta open it up. Well, they will. On November 4th, she'll announce, "Okay, now we're going to open." You know, they're doing that for political reasons.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They think it hurts us in the election. Actually, it helps us, okay? Who has voted so far? Has anyone voted? Okay, good. Because you're saving it, right? You're saving it for Tuesday? Right? No we're good. We're going to have a red wave. They call it the great red wave, like nobody's ever seen before. Like nobody's ever seen.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: So, based on just, you know, early results though, Florida looks like it's phenomenal. Just phenomenal. North Carolina is looking great. They're all looking -- I think they're all looking great. Ohio is looking fantastic. You know, we won Ohio last time by eight points, and, uh, I said, "Well, why are -- " You know, these fo -- these fake polls that they put out, they're called suppression polls.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: If they make them bad enough, they hope you don't wanna waste your time involved, right? We love our president, but he was losing by 250 points. Let's stay home and have dinner darling. And, uh, it doesn't work, as you people don't -- You don't go for the bait, do you? It's really, it's really amazing, and, uh, I think we're winning.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I think we're gonna win everything tom -- I think tomorrow's going to be -- one of the greatest wins in the history of politics. I wanna give a very special thank you also to -- Jared Kushner, who is in the process of negotiating a little thing called peace in the Middle East. Great guy, great guy. They like that.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They like the sound. Peace in the Middle East without blood all over the sand. No blood in the sand, and -- no cost, just peace. Already three countries. UAE, a great leader, Mohammed. Great leader, and, uh, just, you know, three countries have already signed. Bahrain. It's already signed. Sudan -- and we have many, many countries.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: How many do we have lined up? Like, it'll be more than 10, uh -- Now, what would happen if Sleepy Joe Biden had to take over the deal? You know what happens? That's the end of that deal. [Audience boos] You can forget that deal, the sleepy, the sleepy one. Lara Trump, thank you, Lara. What a job you do.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: What a job you do. You know, Lara's a specialist on a place called North Carolina, I will tell you. She lived there and she grew up there. They love her there. And Pennsylvania, that extends to Pennsylvania next door, and you said they were doing phenomenally there, right? So, I think that's right. She said, "Win." I think it, I think they're both wins, big wins.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We gotta be careful, though, because the Pennsylvania deal with that decision, "Oh, you can count the ballots later on and count them whenever you'd like." [Audience boos] No, no. We have to be very, very careful with that. That causes a lot of problems. I wanna thank Kimberly Guilfoyle. Kimberly is fantastic, from day one.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I'd watch her on the five and she always liked me, right from the beginning, so I always liked her. If they don't like me, I never like them. It's funny the way that works. But she was their big star and she did great, and thank you very much, Kimberly. I appreciate it very much. And Tiffany, thank you for the job you do.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: She goes around from place to place. She just graduated from law school. She just graduated from Georgetown. She did a great job. Thank you, honey. Thank you very much. Great job, and Michael, thank you very much. Thank you very much. To all of our supporters here tonight, I really wanna thank you from the bottom of our hearts.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We've, uh, worked very hard in four years. We've been hit by fake, fake investigations -- fake scandals, fake impeachments. We've had, we've had so many things that, uh, the witch hunt. I call it the witch hunt, and it turned out to be a phony witch hunt, and they should've known it the first day. They did know it the first day, but it's the deep state.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: It's whatever you wanna call it, but you know, it should've never happened. Think of it -- They spied on our campaign. [Audience boos] They got caught. They tried to take down a duly elected president of the United States. [Audience boos] They got caught, and you know who knew all about it? Barack Hussein Obama and Sleepy Joe Biden. [Audience boos] They knew all about it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They knew all about it. And then I watched the fake news back there. Look at all of them. Look at all of the fake news. Isn't that -- [Audience boos] It's a lot of fake news. Then I watched the fake news saying, "You know -- "His attitude is a very tough attitude. He's not very nice. He's a very nasty person." No, no, we're defending ourselves.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We're defending all of these people that voted for us-- with these fake -- And then, what happens? It turns out to be that it was them that were guilty of all of these horrible crimes, including the crime of treason, because when you try and take down a duly-elected President, you know it's called treason.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: It's called the big stuff, it's big stuff. So, we're gonna see how that all works out. We're going to see how that -- But, that's another reason we want to go for a long time, frankly, because you know what we started something incredible. We built the greatest economy in the history of the world. We then had to close it down for a period of time.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We saved millions of lives. Remember the original estimate was 2.2 million people would die from the China plague, and they could have kept it in China. They didn't get infected in the rest of China after Wuhan Province, but it came out to the world. It came out to Europe, and the United States, and 188 countries all over the world, and we can never forget that.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We signed a great trade deal with China but it doesn't mean so much -- The ink wasn't dry and all of a sudden this happened and -- But the job we've done when you see the numbers, and you're going to hear the numbers because they're coming out very soon, the job we've done has been an incredible job. We had to close it up.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We saved millions of lives. We now opened it up. You saw what happened, 33.1%. The fastest in the history of our country, the fastest growth, the biggest growth in the history of our country. But, you've been there right from the beginning. We've all been together, and I'll tell you what, we very much appreciate it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Think of how it could have been different, except I think we, in a way we would have been less popular. Somebody said because they would have said, "Just another Presidency." This time you know we had to fight for you, we had a fight. You understood it. You understood the hoax better than anybody. It was a hoax.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: The Russian hoax. And after spending 48 million dollars, 18 angry Democrats, and smart people, vicious, they were vicious, they were smart. If they could find any little morsel, and they went over taxes, and they went over everything you can go over. They spent 48 million dollars, two and a half years, the Mueller Investigation scam, and they come up no collusion.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: There's no collusion after all of that, which makes me perhaps the most innocent man anywhere in the history of the United States. Now, a friend of mine called me up, very smart guy, he said, "I can't imagine anybody could go through two and a half years, 48 million dollars, 18 killers, -- " some of whom worked for Hillary Clinton, right?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Crooked Hillary. [Audience boos]" -- and it turned out they're the ones dealing with Russia. What a disgrace. So, let's see what happens. It's too bad it's going so slowly. There's plenty of info there, and I try and stay uninvolved. Someday I'm going to have to get involved maybe. I try and stay uninvolved.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Going too slowly. "No Sir, we'd rather not do anything before the election." Well, they did it to me before. They did it during, before, and after. These are bad people. Comey, the worst Director in the history of the FBI. Crooked, a crooked person. "Did you leak?" Remember Chuck Grassley. "Did you leak the information to the newspapers?" Uh, uh, he choked when he heard.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Chuck Grassley from Iowa, great gentleman, great gentleman. He looked at that guy. He said, "Did you leak?" And he said, "Yes." He choked. You know, the guy choked like a dog, Comey. He leaked, he lied, he did a lot of things. You saw the report by Inspector General Horowitz, who by the way did a great report.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: That was a great report, Inspector General Horowitz, and I appreciate it. But, you saw that on Comey. Comey should hang his head in disgrace. But, we had to go through all this stuff. Think if we didn't have any of it. We probably wouldn't have done as well. You know, it's true. We might not have done as well, and we might not have these massive crowds, because you saw what was happening.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You got it. We might not have had, so I just want to tell you we appreciate you so much. We really do. We appreciate you so much. Now, we have to build on what we've done. Nobody has done what we've done. No administration has done. [Audience chants "We love you"]Thank you. Wow, I love you, too. I love you, too.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Thank you very much. Thank you. That's really nice. You know, in the history of politics nobody's ever heard that expression before. It's true. Look, Ronald Reagan, we liked Ronald Reagan, right, but nobody ever said, "We love you. We love you." Nobody's ever heard it before. Nobody's heard it before. It's an expression, sure.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You know, they were covering it the other night. They look in the back, oh they want to find it so badly. They want to find somebody so badly. But it's never been said before to the best of anyone's knowledge. And we appreciate it. I tell you what, when you hear that -- I had a nice life. I had the greatest life.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: But you know what? I'm so happy. This was the greatest decision I ever made, because -- We have done so much good together. We've done it together. We couldn't have done it without you, and we've done so much. From the biggest tax cuts in history, to regulation cuts. The biggest ever. We have cut regulations at a level that nobody believes.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: It would take 18 to 20 years to get a highway approved. We have it down to two, it will soon be down to one. And it may not get approved. It may be an environmental problem, it may be a safety problem, but it shouldn't take 20 years, 19 years, one and -- 21 years. And by the time you get it approved it's -- First of all, you start out as a young man on a highway project -- and you end up in retirement.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And then you get a rejection. We rejected three to two some board somewhere. No, we've done a great job. And, uh, we rebuilt our military. We just got a 91% approval from our veterans. Our veterans just gave us a 91% percent approval. Highest we've ever got. With your vote, we will continue to cut your taxes, cut regulations, support our police, support our great military, protect your second amendment, which is gone if sleepy Joe Biden gets -- Defend religious liberty and ensure more products are proudly made with that beautiful, beautiful phrase, right?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Made in the U.S.A. Next year, we will be -- And I mean this. I think we're, we have such a foundation -- This group over here. They're a, they're an activist group. Thank you very much. Thank you fellows. [Audience chants "USA"] It's a great group. Thank you. Thank you very much, we appreciate it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Next year will be the greatest economic year in the history of our country.So you had the -- Last year was the best year you ever had. Before that was the best year. You had three of them with me, and then we got hit with the, uh, the plague. And then we went back to work. Under my leadership, our economy is now growing at the fastest rate ever recorded, 33.1% last week.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And if you look at the auto business, auto business, I don't know what's going on. It's, it's at a level that it's never been at. What is that all about? What is that all about. You wouldn't think. And this is during a pandemic. We're rounding the turn, by the way. We're roun -- They hate it when I say it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: But we're rounding the turn. You know, they used to say, "Look at the way Europe's doing." Well, take a look at Europe, take a look. And what we've done in terms of the economy, we went down less than any major country in the world. Or any country. And now we've gone up far faster, and far higher than any country in the world, it's not even close.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And it could be tougher, because of the size. Because we're a big country. We created a record 11.4 million jobs in the last five months alone, which is another record. That's another big record. We've never hired that many people that fast. While foreign nations are at a free fall, we're creating an economic powerhouse, unrivaled anywhere in the world.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: A recent Gallup poll found that 56% of Americans say they are better off today than they were four years ago, under Obama and Biden.And if Biden and Kamala -- You don't have to say it. Kamala. Kamala. If Biden and Kamala Harris, who's further left by far than crazy Bernie Sanders, right? He's considered a strict conservative compared to her.How the hell did he ever pick her, Mike?
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Where is Mike? How did that ever happen? That turned out -- I don't think that's going to be a good pick. You're going to find out tomorrow. By the way, she happens to be slightly against fracking. She's still against fracking, you know? Isn't that amazing? Isn't that amazing? Biden goes like, "I'm against -- ." For a year and a half, you know he's running, running.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Nobody gave him a chance because he never got more than 1% in prime time, right? 25 years ago, the guy never got 1%. And you know, he never had what it took. He was a glad hander. Not a smart guy. Not a nice guy, either. By the way, not a nice guy. But he was -- I used to call him 1% Joe because he ran for president all the time and he never got more than 1%. Now he's got half the intelligence he had 20 years ago and he wins.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Politics is a strange business, Isn't it? Strange, very strange business. But if Biden and Harris and the radical left gain power, they will collapse our economy and send our nation into a very steep depression. That's what's going to happen. This the only man that I've ever seen run for office on the fact that he wants to give you the largest tax increase in the history Of our country.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: No, that's just, that's his space. He doesn't -- The good news is he has no idea what the hell he's saying, so the -- He goes up, here's his line, "Ladies and gentlemen, we are going to give you the biggest tax crease, increase in the history of our country. It will be $4 trillion." They're going to increase your taxes by $4 trillion. $4 trillion tax increase, that's his campaign.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We gonna -- And they're going to put the money in the green new deal, Which is conceived and dedigna -- designated by AOC plus three, right? AOC plus three. This was their deal. I don't think they ever took an environmental course. Did they go to college by the way? Did -- I don't think they ever took a course on the environment, but Biden wants to raise your taxes $4 trillion, massively increased regulations.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You know, the regulations may have been more important than even the big tax cuts that you got, the biggest ever. You got the biggest tax cuts ever, and you know it, you know it. You felt that in a very, very good place. you know where it is? Your wallet. You felt it in your wallet. They wanted to close down your factories, send your jobs overseas, destroy the suburbs.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: Women of the suburbs, please. Okay. Please. I wiped out a regulation that would have destroyed your home, to put it badly, would have destroyed your American dream. And Ben Carson was a great guy. He said, "Sir, why don't we just do this? Why don't we just sort of ease it up?" It's a horrible regulation.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: What it does is a horrible thing. And everybody knows it. It would have destroyed the suburbs. I said, "Ben, let's just cut it out. Let's terminate it because there's no negotiating. Hear, let's just terminate it." And I terminated it. And you know, one thing I know about the women of the suburbs, they want two things; they want their home, they want their family that, but they want safety and they want security.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And that's what we provide. And I think this will be like four years ago. Remember? "Donald Trump will do very poorly with women at the end of the evening when they're all crying." And I remember they would cry. I remember Martha Raddatz, oh, oh, oh. She's very impartial. She was another one of my debate anchors.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I had some real beauties, didn't they? She was, she was crying and they all said we're going to do badly with women. I'm going to get terribly with women. I, I said, "Why? What's so bad? Tell me what's so bad?" And at the end of the evening, he's done very well with women. What happened now? But this time we're going to do even better because we are providing safety and security.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And we -- And for the suburban women, I mean, we, we're saving the suburbs. This regulation was so horrible. What it does to the suburbs, it would have destroyed the suburbs as we do them. And, you know, I just want to -- I gotta say this, 31% of the people living and moving to the suburbs are minority groups, African-American, Asian-American, Hispanic-American.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: They have a great American dream also. And they want to live in the suburbs and they want to be proud and they don't want to live next to do a project that somebody puts in because they play games with the zoning and other things. And all I can say is for the women, I don't even talk about the men in the suburbs.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I don't care about the men of the suburbs. I only care -- Because they're all saying, "He's going, no, what about us?" I don't worry about you. But the women of the suburbs are going to vote for President Trump because we love you and we're saving you a horrible, a horrible thing was going to happen, frankly.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And it's been happening for years and it has been a very bad situation, So we solved it. We terminated it. It's gone. Now, if they get in, if they should get in, uh, you can take that regulation and quadruple it just like they want to quadruple your taxes. You can quadruple it. So, I think that'll be good.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I think we're going to have a great moments. That's a pretty hard pitch, but that's the way it is, man. They want to dissolve your borders. You know, we complete the wall in a very short period of time. We're over 400 miles.Over 400 miles, and that's right. Mexico is paying for the wall. You know, they like to say Mexico's -- But we, we will have the wall completed very shortly.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We're over 400 miles right now. 400 miles. And we're building 10 miles a week. And we now have the strongest numbers, and the strongest borders, southern border that we've ever had. And you know what? We want people to come into our country. But they have to come in legally, and they have to come in through merit.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We want people that can help us. We want people that can help us. They want to terminate religious liberty, outlaw private healthcare, 400 -- Think of this. Think of this. Private healthcare. You work so hard. You have 180 million people that have a great healthcare plan and love it. Private plans. And they want to end it, and put you on socialized medicine.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I don't think so. [Audience boos] I don't think you'll be -- I don't think you're going to be too happy. I don't think you -- We have a cold, let's go to the hospital, and let's wait for nine days to see a doctor. They want to confiscate your guns, second amendment. [Audience boos] And indoctrinate your children with hateful anti-American lies. [Audience boos] So you'll be happy that I just signed on the plane -- It's beautiful, Air Force One, and it is a beauty, I have to admit -- An executive order to teach our nation's students pro American values [Crosstalk]. Sleepy Joe Biden has vowed to abolish and eradicate the American oil and natural gas industries.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And he's pledged to ban fracking. And you saw that for a year. [Audience boos] More than that. He'd get on stage with all these crazy people, radical left people. And they were screaming. Who could ban it faster. He would say, "Yes, I'd ban fracking. I am totally against fracking." For a year, "I am against fracking." Y -- I could play a hundred clips.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: See the board? Where is the board. I spent a lot of money for that today. I could -- He'd go for a year. "I am against fracking." Then he lucks out, because Elizabeth Pocahontas Warren doesn't get out. So she takes enough worts -- Uh, she takes votes away from crazy Bernie, right? On Super Tuesday. And he loses by a little bit on each state, and Bernie loses again.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: This poor guy, crazy Bernie. But he's running again in four years, don't worry about it. No, he's the best loser I've ever seen. Y -- He can lose. He lost with Hillary. Didn't -- They didn't treat him too well. And then he lost. But Elizabeth Warren lost it. If she would have gotten out, he would have had the votes, he would have won easily.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: So instead of, uh, crazy Bernie, I voted -- I'm running against, uh, sleepy guy, right? I'm running against a very sleepy guy. We can't let the sleepy guy fool us though, because he happens to be a corrupt politician, and they don't want to write it. Biden's energy plan will send every state into a crushing poverty situation, from Michigan to Minnesota.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: We're going to win Minnesota, because of Omar and because we did a great job in stopping the riots in Minneapolis. The National Guard went in. They could have called them a lot sooner. Like a week and a half. You wouldn't have had half your city burnt down. But Arizona, Pennsylvania. We're doing great in Pennsylvania, by the way.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: I just got the word. I just got the word. We're doing great in Pennsylvania. It's looking good. It's act -- I think you're going to have a very exciting -- You're going to have a very exciting evening, or day tomorrow. But evening in particular tomorrow. You know when people see it -- I walk in. We do polls.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And they do a poll. "We interviewed 73 people." "And President Trump is down 57 points." This is a poll. See this is a poll. When you draw crowds like this -- This is not the crowd of somebody that's going to lose the State of Michigan. This is not, this is not -- And look at this drive -- You can't even see the end of it.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: You can't e -- This is not the crowd of a second place finisher. Do you agree with that? No. No. This is our crowd. All together. We're in this together. And we're doing it together. As long as I'm president, we'll remain -- We will remain the number one producer of oil and natural gas anywhere on this planet.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: And for the first time, we are energy independent. You never heard that term before. We're energy independent. And you know, we have good relationships in different parts of the world, and some we help. We don't have to, though. Now we don't have to do. We do what we want, but we have some very good allies and partners, and we'll help them.
speaker: Donald Trump

text: But we don't need their oil anymore. We have so much oil. We have more oil than anybody, okay? And it's, uh, an incredible thing that have -- it's happened over the last few years, a lot of great things, and you're paying what, $2 a gallon for your gasoline? That's okay. You know what that's like? That's like a tax cut.

text: That's bigger than a tax cut. If Biden got in, you'd be paying $7, $8, $9, then they'll say, "Get rid of your car." [Audience boos] "We're gonna get some more windmills. Kill all the birds."
